    • Enum Constant Detail

      • OPTIMIZE_CLIPPING

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option OPTIMIZE_CLIPPING
        This flag uses the Clipper class to avoid using the Area class (if possible) when clipping this Graphics2D.

        This will come into play when this graphics already has a clipping and you ask to further clip it. If one of those two shapes is a rectangle, then the Clipper class can improve performance in calculating the new clip.

      • OPTIMIZE_CLIPPED_SHAPES

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option OPTIMIZE_CLIPPED_SHAPES
        This flag makes sure a shape that you've asked to fill touches the clipped area of this graphics object.

        Surprisingly: a lot of work can occur if you've asked to fill a shape that lies completely outside the clipping.

        This only approximates the current clipping via the bounds of the current clipping. It's still possible with this flag that the incoming shape may not touch the clipped area, but it's still an improvement in several cases.

        (This does not affect draw() methods, because it may not be safe to make assumptions about the size of the stroke without actually calculating it: and calculating the stroke may be unnecessarily expensive.)

      • OPTIMIZE_CLIP_BOUNDS

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option OPTIMIZE_CLIP_BOUNDS
        This optimizes the getClipBounds() method a little.

        This is perhaps a very trivial optimization, performance-wise, but it was easy to implement.

      • OPTIMIZE_GLYPH_VECTORS

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option OPTIMIZE_GLYPH_VECTORS
        When a custom Paint is being used, calls to drawGlyphVector() are very slow. Slower than calling fill(glyphVector.getOutline()).

        This only applies to Macs using Quartz: everywhere else this slows down performance.

      • OPTIMIZE_IMAGE_BACKGROUND

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option OPTIMIZE_IMAGE_BACKGROUND
        Painting an image is slower if a custom Paint is in use. Strange, no? So this flag may change the current paint to a Color before an image is drawn.

        This only applies to Java 1.4; in other environments this makes no difference in performance.

      • FIX_TEXT_RENDERING

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option FIX_TEXT_RENDERING
        When .drawChars() is used through a scaling transform the characters do not scale well. This flag will convert the characters to glyph/shape data, and just call .fill().

      • FIX_QUARTZ_CLIPPING_OFFSET

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option FIX_QUARTZ_CLIPPING_OFFSET
        Using quartz, the clipping offset is off (+.5,+.5). This fixes that offset.

      • OPTIMIZE_QUARTZ_CUSTOM_PAINTS

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option OPTIMIZE_QUARTZ_CUSTOM_PAINTS

      • FIX_GLYPH_VECTORS

        public static final OptimizedGraphics2D.Option FIX_GLYPH_VECTORS
        A crash can occur painting rotated text using Java 1.5. See: http://osdir.com/ml/java-dev/2010-06/msg00415.html
